description: If n = Sum c_i 10^i then a(n) = Sum c_i 2^i.
comments: For n<100, this is the same result as "If n = Sum c_i 10^i then a(n) = Sum c_i (i+1)". - _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 20 2001n_2 in the notation of A122618.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of n
formula: a(n) = 2*a([n/10])+(n mod 10). - _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 20 2001a(0) = 0, a(n) = 2*a(n/10) if n==0 (mod 10), a(n) = a(n-1)+1 otherwise. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 21 2002For all n, a(A007088(n)) = n. - _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 22 2014
prog: (PARI) a(n)=if(n<1,0,if(n%10,a(n-1)+1,2*a(n/10)))(MIT/GNU Scheme) (define (A028897 n) (let loop ((z 0) (i 0) (n n)) (if (zero? n) z (loop (+ z (* (modulo n 10) (expt 2 i))) (1+ i) (floor->exact (/ n 10)))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 22 2014(Haskell)a028897 0 = 0a028897 n = 2 * a028897 n' + d where (n', d) = divMod n 10-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 06 2014
